DOC.brief_summary: The primary objective study evaluate analgesic efficacy 2 dose level V116517 versus placebo .
DOC.brief_title: Analgesic Efficacy Safety V116517 Subjects With Moderate Severe Chronic Pain Due Osteoarthritis ( OA ) Knee
DOC.criteria: Key 1 . Subjects moderate pain due OA knee primary pain condition . 2 . Subjects diagnostic criterion primary pain condition ( American college Rheumatology [ ACR ] clinical radiographic criterion ) : At least 1 follow addition knee pain : age > 50 , stiffness < 30 min , crepitus active motion , KellgrenLawrence ( KL ) grade â‰¥ 2 radiographic evidence within past 2 year . Key 1 . Subjects chronic pain condition OA knee predominant pain condition , include gout , pseudo gout , psoriatic arthritis , active Lyme disease , rheumatoid arthritis inflammatory arthritis , fibromyalgia , neuropathic pain condition , bursitis , acute injury sign active infection target pain area . 2 . Subjects agree stop concomitant analgesic medication , apart specify protocol supplemental analgesic medication . 3 . Subjects history seizure within past 5 year . 4 . Subjects use opioids 4 day per week . 5 . Painconditionspecific exclusion : Subjects receive local paincontrol procedure , include intra articular steroid injection study knee intramuscular steroid injection site within 6 week enter study hyaluronate injection study knee within 12 week enter study . 6 . Subjects arthroscopy either knee hip within 6 month enter study , open surgery either knee hip within 12 month enter study . 7 . Activecomparatorrelated exclusion : Subjects allergic tolerate naproxen acetaminophen , include history NSAIDinduced asthma , nasal polyp ; Subjects history bleed disorder history document gastrointestinal ulcer disease . Other protocol specific inclusion/exclusion criterion may apply .
